measures.network_statistics — Hook Class into Network Simulations¶

This module represents the hook of the measures package into the simulation. Indeed, the class NetworkStats that it provides is used by the network manager and the nodes during the simulation. More accurately, the latter store information in a NetworkStats instance.

This module also provides two classes to ease the computation of means and standard deviations, RunningStat and RegulatStat.

class measures.network_statistics.NetworkStats(net_manager, nb_nodes, sim_params)[source]¶

Bases: object

An instance of this class gathers all statistics and information about a given network run.

Each simulation/network run is associated with one instance of this class. More accurately, a NetworkManager always has a NetworkStats instance as attribute, that it gives to the network and to nodes so that the latter fills it up with information and statistics about the network run.

Note

This class defines attributes dynamically, depending one the values of the booleans in the SimulationParams instance related to the network run. For instance, if log_route_props is True, then NetworkStats will have the attribute nb_route_props_per_node. Otherwise, accessing this attribute will trigger an AttributeError.

In practice, this class contains attributes that are filled up by the network manager, the network, and nodes. These includes, e.g. the number of messages sent/received by nodes, the number of route proposals, the total delay of oriented communications, etc. To avoid too heavy memory consumption, these pieces of information are often gathered and average on the fly, using a RunningStat instance. Average often happens on nodes on the network, on on rounds. See each attribute for details.

The methods of these class are the entry points for the network and the nodes to input information about the network into a NetworkStats instance. The functions only logs information in existing attributes.

log_end_ocom_phase(round)[source]¶

Function logging the end of the oriented communication phase.

Function called by the network manager (NetworkManager). Modifies attribute end_ocom_phase if it exists.

Parameters:round (int) – the round number at which the oriented communications finished.
log_end_topo_diss(round)[source]¶

Function logging the end of the topology dissemination phase.

Function called by the network manager (NetworkManager). Modifies attribute end_topo_diss if it exists.

Parameters:round (int) – the round number at which the topology dissemination finished.
log_msg_placed_in_pool(node, neighbor, msgs)[source]¶

Function logging the insertion of a message in the pools.

Function called by a node (Node).Modifies only protected/private attributes.

Parameters:
  • node (Node) – the node that is inserting the message in its pools.
  • neighbor (int) – the index of the node’s neighbor, specifying in which pool the message is inserted
  • msg (LinkMsg) – the message inserted in the pool
log_ocom_latency(node, end_sender_id, ocom_init_started_at_round, first_payload_sent_at_round)[source]¶

Function logging the latency of an oriented communication.

Function called by a node (Node). Modifies the following attributes if they exist:

  • ocom_latency,
  • ocom_latency_after_init.
Parameters:
  • node (Node) – the node that is concerned by the oriented communication (typically, the end-receiver)
  • end_sender_id (int) – index of the end-sender node
  • ocom_init_started_at_round (int) – the round at which the initialisation of the oriented communication in question was started.
  • first_payload_sent_at_round (int) – the round at which the end-sender started sending payload data in the oriented communication in question.
log_ocom_route(node, ocomid, end_sender, helper, end_rcvr, first_hop_end_sender=None, first_hop_helper=None)[source]¶

Function logging the oriented communication routes

Function called by a node (Node). Modifies the ocom_routes attribute if it exists.

Parameters:
  • node (Node) – the node that is concerned by the oriented communication
  • end_sender (int) – index of the end-sender of the oriented communication
  • helper (int) – index of the indirection node/helper of the oriented communication
  • end_rcvr (int) – index of the end-receiver of the oriented communication
  • first_hop_end_sender (int, optional) – Index of the first hop node or the route chosen by the end-sender, along with the circuit identifier of the first hop. To be supplied when the node calling the function is the end-sender. (Default: None).
  • first_hop_helper (int, optional) – Index of the first hop node or the route chosen by the idirection node/helper, along with the circuit identifier of the first hop. To be supplied when the node calling the function is the helper. (Default: None).
log_round_rcvd_msgs(node, real_messages, nb_reals, nb_dummies, nb_e2e_dummies)[source]¶

Function logging the receiving of messages in a round.

Function called by a node (Node). Modifies the following attributes if they exist:

  • nb_rcvd_real_msgs_per_node,
  • nb_end_rcvd_real_msgs_per_node,
  • nb_end_rcvd_ocom_msgs_per_node,
  • nb_end_rcvd_ocom_payload_msgs_per_node,
  • rcvd_link_msgs_per_node_per_round,
  • nb_rcvd_dummy_link_msgs_per_node,
  • nb_rcvd_e2e_dummy_msgs,
  • histogram_nb_real_link_msgs_rcvd_per_round.
Parameters:
  • node (Node) – the node that is received the messages (node.batching_round gives the current round)
  • real_messages (list of LinkMsg) – the real of messages received
  • nb_reals (int) – number of real messages received
  • nb_dummies (int) – number of dummy (link) messages received
  • nb_e2e_dummies (int) – number of end-to-end dummy messages received
log_rt_prop(node, rt_prop_event, nb_to_log=1, nb_rounds_to_complete=None)[source]¶

Function logging information about route proposal.

Function called by a node (Node). Modifies the following attributes if they exist:

  • nb_route_props_per_node,
  • rt_props_latency.
Parameters:
  • node (Node) – the node that is concerned by the route proposal
  • rt_prop_event (str or RtPolicyReason) – the event that is to be logged. Can be ‘received’, ‘proposed’, ‘rt_prop_event’, or a RtPolicyReason value.
  • nb_to_log (int, optional) – number occurence of the event type to log (Default: 1)
  • nb_rounds_to_complete (int, optional) – if the event type in rt_prop_event is a RtPolicyReason value, this argument specified the number of rounds that were necessary to complete the route proposal, starting from the initial rtprop message (Default: None)
log_sent_batch(node, batch, nb_reals, nb_dummies, nb_e2e_dummies, remove_real=0, replace_dummy_by_e2e_dummy=0, add_e2e_dummy=0, add_many_dummies=0, default_dummy_broadcast=0)[source]¶

Function logging the sending of a batch of messages at the end of a round

Function called by a node (Node). Modifies the following attributes if they exist:

  • nb_sent_real_msgs_per_node,
  • nb_end_sent_real_msgs_per_node,
  • nb_end_sent_ocom_msgs_per_node,
  • nb_end_sent_ocom_payload_msgs_per_node,
  • sent_link_msgs_per_node_per_round,
  • nb_sent_dummy_link_msgs_per_node,
  • nb_sent_e2e_dummy_msgs,
  • real_msg_waiting_time,
  • histogram_real_msg_waiting_time,
  • nb_batch_intervention_remove_reals,
  • nb_batch_intervention_replace_dummy_by_e2e_dummy,
  • nb_batch_intervention_add_e2e_dummy,
  • nb_batch_intervention_many_dummies,
  • nb_batch_intervention_default_dummy_bcast,
  • histogram_nb_real_link_msgs_sent_per_round,
  • histogram_nb_sent_link_msgs_per_round_per_neighbor.
Parameters:
  • node (Node) – the node that is sending the batch (node.batching_round gives the current round)
  • batch (list of LinkMsg) – the batch of message being sent
  • nb_reals (int) – number of real messages in the batch
  • nb_dummies (int) – number of dummy (link) messages in the batch
  • nb_e2e_dummies (int) – number of end-to-end dummy messages in the batch
  • remove_real (int, optional) – number of real messages that were manually removed from the batch to fulfill the traffic rates constraints (first type of batch intervention)
  • replace_dummy_by_e2e_dummy (int, optional) – number of times a dummy in the batch was replaced by an end-to-end dummy to fulfill the traffic rates constraints (second type of batch intervention)
  • add_e2e_dummy (int, optional) – number of end-to-end dummy messages added in the batch to fulfill the traffic rates constraints (third type of batch intervention)
  • add_many_dummies (int, optional) – number of dummy messages added (because, at the time, no end-to-end dummy could be produced) in order to fulfill the traffic rates constraints (fourth type of batch intervention)
  • default_dummy_broadcast (int, optional) – equals to 1 if the node resorted to a simple broadcast of one dummy message to each neighbor, because the batch was empty (last type of batch intervention)
log_traffic_rate_equilibrium(node, equilibrium, lbound_real_msgs, ubound_real_msgs)[source]¶

Function logging the traffic rates counters and equilibirum.

Function called by a node (Node). Modifies the traffic_rate_status attribute if it exists.

Parameters:
  • node (Node) – the node that is calling the function
  • equilibrium (int) – equilibirum of the node in the current round
  • lbound_real_msgs (int) – lower bound on real messages of the node in the current round
  • ubound_real_msgs (int) – upper bound on real messages of the node in the current round
end_ocom_phase = None¶

int – The round number at which the oriented communication phase is finished.

Defined only if log_end_ocom_phase is True.

end_topo_diss = None¶

int – The round number at which the topology is fully disseminated.

Defined only if log_end_topo_diss is True.

histogram_nb_real_link_msgs_rcvd_per_round = None¶

collections.defaultdict – Histogram of real link messages received per round.

Dict triply indexed: dict[n][[node][neighbor] = v, meaning that the node “node” received n real messages from neighbor “neighbor” on v occasions during the network run.

Defined only if log_histogram_real_msgs_per_round is True.

histogram_nb_real_link_msgs_sent_per_round = None¶

collections.defaultdict – Histogram of real link messages sent per round.

Dict triply indexed: dict[n][[node][neighbor] = v, means that the node node sent n real messages to neighbor neighbor on v occasions during the network run

Defined only if log_histogram_real_msgs_per_round is True.

histogram_nb_sent_link_msgs_per_round_per_neighbor = None¶

collections.defaultdict – The histogram number of link messages sent to each neighbor at each round. Is expected to be one or two, but not much more

Dict indexed by the number of link messages sent per round (all nodes confunded), and which values are the number of occurences of this number. That is, if d[n] = m, this means that on m occasions, a node (any one node in the network) sent n link messages during a round.

Defined only if log_sent_link_msgs_per_round is True.

histogram_real_msg_waiting_time = None¶

collections.defaultdict – The histogram of number of rounds a real messages waits in pools.

Dict indexed by number of rounds, values are number of occurrences.

Defined only if one of or both log_real_msgs_waiting_time or log_histogram_real_msgs_waiting_time are True.

nb_batch_intervention_add_e2e_dummy = None¶

RunningStat – The number of times each node had to modify the batch, adding an e2e dummy plus link dummies.

This value is averaged over rounds and nodes.

Defined only if log_frequency_batch_intervention is True.

nb_batch_intervention_default_dummy_bcast = None¶

RunningStat – The number of times each node resorted to the default option of sending one dummy to each neighbor.

This value is averaged over rounds and nodes.

Defined only if log_frequency_batch_intervention is True.

nb_batch_intervention_many_dummies = None¶

RunningStat – The number of times each node had to modify the batch by adding many dummies because no e2e dummy was possible.

This value is averaged over rounds and nodes.

Defined only if log_frequency_batch_intervention is True.

nb_batch_intervention_remove_reals = None¶

RunningStat – The number of times each node had to modify the batch, by removing real messages.

This value is averaged over rounds and nodes.

Defined only if log_frequency_batch_intervention is True.

nb_batch_intervention_replace_dummy_by_e2e_dummy = None¶

RunningStat – The number of times each node had to modify the batch, by replacing one dummy by an e2e dummy.

This value is averaged over rounds and nodes.

Defined only if log_frequency_batch_intervention is True.

nb_end_rcvd_ocom_msgs_per_node = None¶

collections.defaultdict – Number of (real) oriented communication message end-received by each node at each round.

Dict indexed by nodes, which values are RunningStat instances, averaging over rounds.

Defined only if log_real_e2e_msgs is True.

nb_end_rcvd_ocom_payload_msgs_per_node = None¶

collections.defaultdict – Number of (real) oriented communication payload message end-received by each node at each round, i.e. without counting ocom init.

Dict indexed by nodes, which values are RunningStat instances, averaging over rounds.

Defined only if log_real_e2e_msgs is True.

nb_end_rcvd_real_msgs_per_node = None¶

collections.defaultdict – Number of (real) messages end-received by each node at each round.

Dict indexed by nodes, which values are RunningStat instances, averaging over rounds.

Defined only if log_real_e2e_msgs is True.

nb_end_sent_ocom_msgs_per_node = None¶

collections.defaultdict – Number of (real) oriented communication message end-sent by each node at each round.

Dict indexed by nodes, which values are RunningStat instances, averaging over rounds.

Defined only if log_real_e2e_msgs is True.

nb_end_sent_ocom_payload_msgs_per_node = None¶

collections.defaultdict – Number of (real) oriented communication payload message end-sent by each node at each round, i.e. without counting ocom init.

Dict indexed by nodes, which values are RunningStat instances, averaging over rounds.

Defined only if log_real_e2e_msgs is True.

nb_end_sent_real_msgs_per_node = None¶

collections.defaultdict – Number of (real) messages end-sent by each node at each round.

Dict indexed by nodes, which values are RunningStat instances, averaging over rounds.

Defined only if log_real_e2e_msgs is True.

nb_rcvd_dummy_link_msgs_per_node = None¶

collections.defaultdict – Total number of dummy link messages received by each node at each round.

Dict indexed by nodes, which values are RunningStat instances, averaging over rounds.

Defined only if log_dummy_link_msgs is True.

nb_rcvd_e2e_dummy_msgs = None¶

RunningStat – Total number of end-to-end dummy message received by each node at each round.

This value is averaged over rounds and nodes.

Defined only if log_e2e_dummies is True.

nb_rcvd_real_msgs_per_node = None¶

collections.defaultdict – Number of real link messages received by each node at each round.

Dict indexed by nodes, which values are RunningStat instances, averaging over rounds.

Defined only if log_real_link_msgs is True.

nb_route_props_per_node = None¶

dict – The number of route proposals the node was involved in, with which role, and which outcomes.

Dict doubly indexed. First by type of route proposal event (‘proposed’, ‘answered_as_receiver’, plus all RtPolicyReason), and then by nodes. Values are the number of occurences of the event. For instance, d[‘proposed’][n1] = 5 means that node n1 proposed 5 routes.

Defined only if log_route_props is True.

nb_sent_dummy_link_msgs_per_node = None¶

collections.defaultdict – Total number of dummy link messages sent by each node at each round.

Dict indexed by nodes, which values are RunningStat instances, averaging over rounds.

Defined only if log_dummy_link_msgs is True.

nb_sent_e2e_dummy_msgs = None¶

RunningStat – Total number of end-to-end dummy messages sent by each node at each round.

This value is averaged over rounds and nodes.

Defined only if log_e2e_dummies is True.

nb_sent_real_msgs_per_node = None¶

collections.defaultdict – Number of real link messages sent by each node at each round.

Dict indexed by nodes, which values are RunningStat instances, averaging over rounds.

Defined only if log_real_link_msgs is True.

network_end_time = None¶

float – The time at which the network run ended, based on a call to time.time() (i.e. based on the system time, not SimPy time)

network_start_time = None¶

float – The time at which the network run was started, based on a call to time.time() (i.e. based on the system time, not SimPy time)

ocom_latency = None¶

RunningStat – The latency, in rounds, between the initialization of an ocom, and the receiving of the last message by the end-receiver.

Average over all oriented communications in the network.

Defined only if log_ocom_latency is True.

ocom_latency_after_init = None¶

RunningStat – The latency, in rounds, between the sending of the first payload message of the ocom, and the receiving of the last one

Average over all oriented communications in the network

Defined only if log_ocom_latency is True.

ocom_routes = None¶

dict – Minimal description of all oriented communication routes used in the network.

The dict is indexed by oriented communication identifier. For each such communication, it specifies the end sender and its first hop, plus helper and its first hop (i.e. values of the dict are dicts, indexed by {‘end_sender’, ‘helper’, ‘end_rcvr’, ‘first_hop_end_sender’}).

Defined only if log_ocom_routes is True.

rcvd_link_msgs_per_node_per_round = None¶

collections.defaultdict – All received link messages by each node at each round.

This dict is defined similarly as sent_link_msgs_per_node_per_round, for received link messages.

Defined only if log_and_store_all_real_msgs is True.

Warning

Heavy memory consumption

real_msg_waiting_time = None¶

RunningStat – The number of rounds real messages spend waiting in pools.

This value is averaged over all real messages, all nodes, and all rounds.

Defined only if one of or both log_real_msgs_waiting_time or log_histogram_real_msgs_waiting_time are True.

rt_props_latency = None¶

RunningStat – The latency of route proposals between the initial rt prop message to the acceptation/refusal by the proposee.

This value is averaged over every route proposal in the network.

Defined only if log_rt_props_latency is True.

sent_link_msgs_per_node_per_round = None¶

collections.defaultdict – All sent link messages by each node at each round.

The dict is indexed by nodes, its values are dict, which indexes are batching rounds, and values are the messages sent by the node in the batching round. That is if d[n][r] = [m1, m2, ...], then node n sent the real messages m1, m2, ... in round r.

Defined only if log_and_store_all_real_msgs is True.

Warning

Heavy memory consumption

traffic_rate_status = None¶

dict – The equilibirum, minimum and maximum number of real messages that each node can send each round.

Dict indexed by {equilibrium, lbround, ubound}, which values are RunningStat instances, averaging over rounds and nodes.

Defined only if log_traffic_rates_equilibrium is True.

class measures.network_statistics.RegularStat(values)[source]¶

Bases: measures.network_statistics.Stat

Computes statistics in a “regular manner” on a supplied list of values.

Parameters:values (list of numbers) – the values on which the statistics must be computed.
max¶

float – Maximum of all values provided to the class instance

mean¶

float – Mean of all values provided to the class instance

min¶

float – Minimum of all values provided to the class instance

nb_values¶

int – Total number of values provided to the class instance.

stdev¶

float – Standard deviation of all values provided to the class instance

total¶

float – Total sum of all values provided to the class instance

variance¶

float – Variance of all values provided to the class instance

class measures.network_statistics.RunningStat[source]¶

Bases: measures.network_statistics.Stat

Comutes statistics on streaming data.

Instead of computing directly the average etc. on a list of values, this class allows to compute values arriving in stream. This saves a lot a of memory when gathering statistics in the network with NetworkStats. Values are given one by one to an instance of this class by using the push_value() method. The attribtues mean, stdev can be accessed at any time, even before the stream of data is still ongoing.

Note that, while the average, minimum, and maximum can be easily computed on streaming data, the standard deviation and variance are more tricky. The implementation of this class is inspired from https://www.johndcook.com/blog/standard_deviation/

push_value(v)[source]¶

Updates all statistics (average, standard deviation) according to the specified value.

Parameters:v (float) – the new value of the data stream
max¶

float – Maximum of all values provided to the class instance

mean¶

float – Mean of all values provided to the class instance

min¶

float – Minimum of all values provided to the class instance

nb_values¶

int – Total number of values provided to the class instance.

stdev¶

float – Standard deviation of all values provided to the class instance

total¶

float – Total sum of all values provided to the class instance

variance¶

float – Variance of all values provided to the class instance

class measures.network_statistics.Stat[source]¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Abstract base class for RegularStat and RunningStat.

This class (or more exactly, its derivatives), are meant to provide shortcuts to compute means, standard deviation, variances, minimum, and maximum values.

max¶

float – Maximum of all values provided to the class instance

mean¶

float – Mean of all values provided to the class instance

min¶

float – Minimum of all values provided to the class instance

nb_values¶

int – Total number of values provided to the class instance.

stdev¶

float – Standard deviation of all values provided to the class instance

total¶

float – Total sum of all values provided to the class instance

variance¶

float – Variance of all values provided to the class instance
